psychosis.description: I observe my father's relentless pursuit of approval from family members and struggle with recognizing similar patterns in my own behavior.
I fear losing my father's support and struggle with feelings of abandonment when familial relationships become strained.
While I am starting to set boundaries with certain family members, I find it challenging and experience guilt or anxiety when I do.
I feel torn between seeking familial approval to feel valued and protecting myself by disengaging from unhealthy family dynamics.
I anticipate conflict and feel tense about expressing my own needs or decisions, especially when they differ from my familyâ€™s expectations.
I often apologize quickly after disagreements with family members to restore harmony, even when I feel justified in my stance.

psychosis.topic: Comparing myself negatively to my father
psychosis.description: I question whether my behaviors, like seeking approval, make me similar to my father, which increases my self-doubt and anxiety.
I am working to recognize and challenge unhealthy patterns in my family relationships, though this is met with internal conflict and external resistance.
